FuncDef: The upgrade cmu command upgrades the MonitorBus of the Control Monitor Unit (CMU).
CLIs: upgrade cmu { slot <slot-id> | all } { <filename> | startup } monitorbus [ force ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot number of the CMU.
-

Indicates all CMUs that are installed.
-

Specifies the name of the system software stored in the CF card.
The value is a string of 4 to 127 characters, spaces not supported.

Upgrades the Router to the current startup system software.
-

Indicates the MonitorBus of the CMU.
-

Forces the upgrade, regardless of the version consistency.
-

Examples: *                     W A R N I N G                     *
* Please ensure that the configuration has been saved.  *
* And please ensure that the board does not be powered  *
* off or be reseted during the upgrade operation.       *
* Also ensure that any board of this device is not      *
* removed (pull out or plug in) during this process.    *
*                     W A R N I N G                     *
Info:The current product can not support this operation.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the check version startup command output indicates that the CMU version is inconsistent with the specified system software version, run the upgrade cmu command to upgrade the CMU.
Implementation Procedure
When running the upgrade cmu command, enter Y or N to determine whether to run the command.
Configuration Impact
There are two modes for upgrading the items:
Upgrade the items without using the parameter force.
The system first checks whether the monitorbus of the CMU match the system software. Then, it upgrades the unmatched items.
Upgrade the items using the parameter force.
The system directly upgrades the monitorbus of the CMU without checking whether the monitorbus match the system software.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
